author: bolt988

text:
I would like to understand the fact clearly. When will the 1% TDS being deducted? When will the 30% Tax will be deducted?

I will explain my understanding so far. Correct me if I misunderstood/wrong at any point.

Firstly we will deposit our money (INR) from bank to crypto exchange wallet. During this money transfer, 1% TDS will deducted to monitor the each person crypto transaction/investment activity by govt. 

Then we will buy any crypto tokens in crypto exchange and hold it for certain period. After some period, we sell the holding crypto token and booking profit. Then we will receive our money in crypto wallet. I believe the money which is staying at crypto wallet won't be taxed until it will be moved to bank account. Am I correct?

(Or)

Will govt deduct the 30% tax on crypto gain from crypto exchange wallet itself? Is it possible? Does Indian crypto exchange agreed to this? Any order/document published by crypto exchanges regarding this?

text: Wrong assessment! You have to pay tax on transfer of any virtual digital asset. It doesn‚Äôt matter if you take money in bank account or not. You have to pay tax even if you don‚Äôt take money in bank account and buy another stocks with that money.

author: vyom shah

text: Hey Akshat, I actually don‚Äôt agree with you on this. Even if you are converting your BTC to USDT, you still are obliged to pay taxes on your gains you made in INR equivalent in BTC. The tax will apply on the gains on any asset as soon as the transaction is completed (I.e buy and sell of that asset is completed). Government can easily get your crypto transaction details from the centralised exchanges and you might be penalised for evading tax if you try to go via this USDT rule to evade it. As someone else in the comments said you can‚Äôt save tax if you convert your cash to gold. I would highly recommend you make another video after consulting with tax experts so that the normal audience is not misled.

text:
I feel introducing taxes on crypto is a very smart move by the govt. on one hand crypto has the power to undermine the whole banking system and at the same the govt is willing to take that risk albiet at 30% commision. Crypto is a decentralised asset, the apps in recent years have tried to make money by indirectly centralising it and now the govts world over are jumping in to gain from it. 
I do believe that it‚Äôs futile to think of ways to circumvent the tax, IT Deptt has jus been given free hand by the govt to track everything and the budget print leaves many a words to interpretation. 
Why not collect crypto as just a hobby? üòÅ Who knows what the future holds üôÉ

author: Neeraj Chaudhary

text:
What is this nonsense  30% tax on profit on every transaction? ü§î if we earn profit using our brain burning the midnight oil to watch all the ups and downs 24 hours we have to give 30 % to govt but if losses occur nobody  comes to rescue.  If we earn 10rs profit we give 3 rs to government   then next day if we get 10 rs loss we have to bearüò° 
Atleast in stock market we can be peaceful after 3:30 pm and weekends.  Here we risk our money and dedicate ourselves full time and share 30 % profit with the govt? Crypto is not purely luck  it is a new concept designed for the benefit of the mankind and free us from the clutches of unscrupulous govts worldwide.
Atleast in lottery tickets we buy and keep our fingers crossed and if we did win the prize  we give 30% to govt   is crypto equal to a lottery scheme?
How can capital gains apply to every transaction? Normally properties are not sold frequently like say everyday every fortnight every month every year  but crypto is bought and sold at the spur of the moment going by the global trends 
  This 30% tax per transaction will kill the will of the people who r believing crypto would bring some sunshine into their lives.   

This is totally unfair.Atleast they should apply this 30% every year end
author: chandrakala gowrishetty
